testcase.author: SecureSoftware, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Format string problems occur when a user has the ability to control or write completely the format string used to format data in the printf style family of C/C++ functions (flawed).

testcase.author: PLOVER, Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A printf is called with a user supplied format string.

testcase.author: PLOVER, Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A syslog is called with a user supplied format string. An attempt was made to preformat the buffer but the vulnerability remains.

testcase.author: PLOVER, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A malloc-ed data is freed more than once.

testcase.author: PLOVER, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A file is accessed multiple times by name in a publically accessible directory. A race condition exists between the accesses where an attacker can replace the file referenced by the name.

testcase.author: PLOVER, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A system() is called with user-provided data.

flaw.name: CWE-078: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A string decode function misses a termination check which allows the decode to proceed past the end of the buffer.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: An ad hoc gets without bounds check allows a stack buffer to be overrun.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: An ad-hoc string copy without bounds check overflows a stack buffer.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A syslog is called with a user supplied format string. An attempt was made to preformat the buffer but the vulnerability remains.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A printf is called with a user format string. This is a defect.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A gets is never safe for untrusted input due to lack of buffer length checks.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: An fgets is called with an incorrect bound allowing a stack buffer to be overrun.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Integer overflow results in a short malloc and an overflow. A guard was put in place to protect the overflow but the guard is incorrect.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A malloc-ed data is never freed and all pointers to the data are lost.

flaw.name: CWE-401: Improper Release of Memory Before Removing Last Reference ('Memory Leak')

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A malloc-ed data is returned to the caller but never freed.

flaw.name: CWE-401: Improper Release of Memory Before Removing Last Reference ('Memory Leak')

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A malloc-ed data is freed before being returned to the caller and freed again.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A strcpy overflows a stack buffer. A check was made to avoid an overflow condition but the check is off by one.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A length check is not made before strcpy, causing heap buffer overflow.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A strncpy is used to copy a string but the length is given incorrectly leading to a heap buffer overflow.

testcase.author: Fortify Software, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A strcpy is used to copy a string into a heap buffer. The caller shortens the string but an overflow condition is still allowed.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Test if tool can detect a heap inspection vulnerability (flawed).

flaw.name: CWE-244: Improper Clearing of Heap Memory Before Release ('Heap Inspection')

testcase.author: Redge Bartholomew, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Stack-based Buffer Overflow.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Test of tool ability to identify use of an uninitialized variable (flawed).

testcase.author: CLASP/SecureSoftware, Paul E. Black, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Accidentally refer to the wrong memory address due to the semantics of when math operations are implicitly scaled.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Cross-Site Scripting of a CGI program in C that takes the arguments and print it out.

flaw.name: CWE-080: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)

testcase.instruction: gcc -Wall -g -O0 -std=gnu99 -o sql_select-bad sql_select-bad.c -lmysqlclient (Requires mysql library for mysql.h in order to compile.)
testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The SQL Injection is possible because the arguments are not validated before the MySQL query.

flaw.name: CWE-089: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

testcase.instruction: gcc -Wall -g -O0 -std=gnu99 -o sql_array-bad sql_array-bad.c -lmysqlclient (Requires mysql library for mysql.h in order to compile.)
testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The SQL Injection is possible if the arguments are not validated.

flaw.name: CWE-089: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

testcase.instruction: gcc -Wall -g -O0 -std=gnu99 -o sql_scope-bad sql_scope-bad.c -lmysqlclient (Requires mysql library for mysql.h in order to compile.)
testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The SQL Injection is possible because the arguments are not validated. The code complexity is in the call of another function to perform the MySQL query.

flaw.name: CWE-089: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) race condition between checking access permissions and then opening and writing to the file.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) race condition between checking access permissions and then opening and writing to the file using random calls to function pointers.

testcase.author: NIST, SecureSoftware/CLASP, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The use of a hard-coded password increases the possibility of password guessing tremendously.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows a double free in a local control flow complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows a double free in a for loop structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case exposes a format string vulnerability with a container code complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows a format string vulnerability in a local control flow; here, we use function pointer for control flow.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows hard-coded passwords; these passwords are in a array.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a password which is hard-coded in the source code, the password is stored in a C structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows a hard-coded password in a local control flow.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows a hard coded password in a for loop structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows Heap Overflow with an array complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case exposes Heap Overflow with an array index complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case shows an improper null termination; fread does not add the null character at the end of the string.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows an improper null termination with an address alias level as code complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes an improper null termination in a string which is in a structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: This test case exposes an improper null termination which occurs when argv contains tainted data.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a leftover debug weakness. Basically developer can debug his code and get the root promotion for debugging.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows how it is easy to get a buffer overflow if a string function is misused.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows how it is easy to get a buffer overflow if a string function is misused with an address alias level code complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows how it is easy to get a buffer overflow if a string function is misusedÂ with a string which is in a structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows how it is easy to get a buffer overflow if a string function is misused with scope complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows how it is easy to get a buffer overflow if a string function is misused when argv contains tainted data.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a null dereference with an address alias level as code complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a null dereference.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes an OS Command Injection weakness in a local control flow.

flaw.name: CWE-078: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes an OS Command Injection weakness in a loop.

flaw.name: CWE-078: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes an OS Command Injection in scope complexity.

flaw.name: CWE-078: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a resource injection with an address alias level code complexity.

flaw.name: CWE-099: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a resource injection.

flaw.name: CWE-099: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a resource injection with a string which is in a structure.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a resource injection weakness in a scoping context.

flaw.name: CWE-099: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Stack Overflow with a bad array index.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Stack Overflow with an off-by-one array index.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a Stack Overflow with a bad loop exit condition (and start index).

testcase.description: The test case shows a use of an allocated memory after being freed with an extra allocation and free complexity.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in a C/CGI program with a string which is in a structure.

flaw.name: CWE-080: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case exposes a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in a C/CGI program with scope complexity.

flaw.name: CWE-080: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a memory leak with a pointer which is in a structure.

flaw.name: CWE-401: Improper Release of Memory Before Removing Last Reference ('Memory Leak')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a memory leak occurring due to memory not being released inside of a loop.

flaw.name: CWE-401: Improper Release of Memory Before Removing Last Reference ('Memory Leak')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows an unintentional pointer scaling.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: If we do not check the return of scanf we do not know how many parameters have been passed.

testcase.instruction: gcc -Wall -g -O0 -std=gnu99 -o sql_injection_loop-bad sql_injection_loop-bad.c -lmysqlclient (Requires mysql library for mysql.h in order to compile.)
testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The SQL Injection is possible because the arguments are not validated before the MySQL query.

flaw.name: CWE-089: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Memory leak, the allocated memory is never freed.

flaw.name: CWE-401: Improper Release of Memory Before Removing Last Reference ('Memory Leak')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Using the value of an unitialized variable is not safe.

testcase.author: Robert C. Seacord, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Buffer overflow if the input is not validated. Every operation may write outside the bound of the statically allocated character array.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a weakness of improper null termination with a buffer address type complexity.

testcase.author: Michale Koo, SecureSoftware, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Using the value of an unitialized variable is not safe.

testcase.author: NIST, Romain Gaucher, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test cases implements CVE-2002-1869: Does not check if you can write a log file allow attackers to avoid logging.

testcase.author: NIST, SecureSoftware, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: A heap overflow condition is a buffer overflow, where the buffer that can be overwritten is allocated in the heap portion of memory, generally meaning that the buffer was allocated using a routine such as the POSIX malloc() call.

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: The test case shows a use of an allocated memory after being freed.

testcase.author: NIST, SecureSoftware, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Command injection problems are a subset of injection problem, in which the process is tricked into calling external processes of the attackers choice through the injection of control-plane data into the data plane.

flaw.name: CWE-078: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

testcase.author: NIST, Alexander Hoole, Aurelien Delaitre
testcase.description: Pointer may contain garbage and pass in the check.

testcase.description: This test case may dereference a NULL pointer.

flaw.name: CWE-080: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)
